text: During our ER rotation in med school,
my roommate fell in love with emergency medicine.
Avery.
Care to tell me why you've pulled
all of my residents from the ER?
Yeah, I just wanted to speed up our free COVID testing.
But, I mean, hey, if you want, I guess we could...
We could start turning them away.
It's a great program.
Forget I asked, okay?
She loved being on the frontline.
She felt that's where she had the most impact.
But I knew, three days in,
emergency medicine was not for me.
Most treatments were meant to just tide patients over
until they could see their own physician,
a specialist, or a surgeon.
And how is her base deficit?
Same as I told you five minutes ago.
And her inflammatory markers?
Altman, we would not be here without your tireless effort.
But you still have two days off.
Enjoy them,
because you're gonna miss them when you're back.
Okay. Thanks. Uh, one more thing...
Goodbye, Altman.
And I thought, "What's the point
of starting something you won't get to finish?"
...closer, I saw it didn't have a ball in its mouth,
it had an avocado.
No idea where he got it from.
You're gonna love dogs.
Oh, you're gonna love everything about the outside. Mm-hmm.
The trees, grass, rainbows.
Isn't that right, Luna?
Wait, wait, wait! Wait, wait.
Say her name again. Why?
Because I think she understood it.
Her face changed.
Yeah, Luna... Luna.
Luuuna... Luna!
For what it's worth, she doesn't respond
when I say her name, either.
Yes, she does. She's a genius.
All right if I complete my rounds now?
Or is she such a genius that she can look after herself?
No. Go ahead. Mm-hmm. Mm-hmm.
Wilson, Chief,
while I think these visits do Luna the world of good,
I have about 15 other patients and their very worried parents
waiting for me, so if you don't mind...
Nyah nyah nyah nyah nyah. Mm-hmm.
Thank you.

not in the hamper.

Still do.
Okay.

Neither.

and we can all just melt.

Is it for us?
Is it for us?

while we took in the scenery.

You're say... you want to take everyone from here?

Impossible without help.

Okay.
Yes! Yay! Come on!

We couldn't have asked for a better daughter-in-law.

and even if you haven't gotten around to proposing,

I'll go get Scout.
I can't wait to meet my grandson!

I can go again if you want.

Ready for you, sir.

Good. Smart. Okay.

All right, one more.
Great. All set. Yeah.

so about 30 minutes for your results.

Thank you so much.
You're very welcome. Thank you.

You taught me to push myself, to innovate,
to see what's possible, and to trust my instinct.
And right now, that's telling me to change to OB.
Go with God?

go ahead.

diagnosed with multiple VSDs,
cardiomyopathy, and heart failure.
He's currently on day 12 of ECMO,
waiting for a transplant, status 1A.
We thought this would only be for a few days.
Do a lot of kids with his condition stay on it this long?
It's unusual.
It means he's strong.
He's already held his own through several procedures.
None of which have fixed the holes in his heart.
We're hoping he can hang on a little bit longer,
until a donor heart comes through.
I'll be back to you in a couple of hours, okay?
Chief. Welcome back.
Mm.

Yep, ran right up the loading ramp.
They had to cut open the side of the van. Mm.
Newlyweds, I heard.
Hell of a honeymoon.
Huh.
Shayne Riley, 45.
Unstable pelvis and lower abdominal pains
after sustaining crush injuries in an MVC.

after saline boluses.
Shayne, you are in good hands now,
and I'm not just saying that

Patient complains of headache.

I didn't mean it!
Wait, can he hear me?

I can hear her just fine. I'm just not talking to her.

This is great news.
It's not great news?

if she's too weak to stay awake.

He really hates needles.

When we were in the accident,
I kinda said a thing, and I feel terrible.

I don't think so.
So, what? You cheated on him?

Please and thank you. Squeeze my hands, please.
I told the paramedics to save me first.
Over him, my husband.

Can you please tell him I'm okay?
Yeah. Let's go.

That except for her, no one would miss me if I died.

Dr. Hunt knows that...
Does this hurt?
Ow! Yeah.

but you will need a surgery, okay?
Shayne, we're taking Karissa to CT,
but she is stable and she's feeling okay.

No, she's very worried about you.
Good. Don't tell her how I am.
She doesn't get to know anything.
Let's go.
I'm just gonna not tell her anything?
She's terrified.
You know the rules.
It's not just me, right?
This is weird.
Super weird.
It's like we won the lottery of silence.
Where do we even start?
By getting naked?
Okay.
Loving that.
Whoa, Amelia.
I don't think you're grasping
the extent of our freedom here.
There are no baby monitors.
There are no homework assignments,
no one's... No one's hungry.
I'm a little hungry.
Then let's have sex in the kitchen.
We can do whatever we want.
You realize that?
We can... We can be loud.

Okay.
All right. Amelia...
look at me.

I-I-I thought you were crying because my mom and Zola...

I'm... I'm not, just...
I just really need to be crying right now!
Okay.
Marcel tested positive.
He needs to be home, isolating.
I told him that, but apparently, he lives with his family...
Six people in a two-bedroom apartment,
including his grandpa.
He doesn't want to get them sick.
Can't we just admit him?
Get him some care and a place...
This is not a hotel, Schmitt.
He can't afford to stay anywhere else.
Okay. Book him a hotel room.
On you? Are you sure?

Dr. Feldman to the Step Down Unit.
Chris?

Listen, it's...

She's so depressed, she can't get out of bed.
When COVID hit,
seeing people lose whole families in a week...
we knew we had to be careful

And we were.
And in the end, it didn't matter.
I'm still losing them.
The only thing keeping me going right now

Arthur gets a heart,
Hollie comes back to life...
and we a family again.
And I know we can't have our miracle
unless someone else loses theirs.
Lives what I'm living right now.
Gets shattered.
And I pray for it anyway.
'Cause Arthur...
He's your son.
I can't lose him, Dr. Hayes.
We can't lose him.
Please.
How's she looking?
Squirmy.

Uh...
Sorry, Karissa. Um, patient confidentiality.
Confidentiality?
From his wife?
Wait.
Did he ask you not to tell me?
That is also confidential.
He's still mad.

Well, neither is six years.
Scans are up.
Karissa, you have a very small contusion on your brain.
It's benign with a very minor bleed,
so minor I don't think we can blame it for anything.
Sorry.
But we do have to keep you overnight for observation.
I was wrong.
I was wrong that no one would miss him.
Because it's only been a few hours,
and I miss him so much I could burst.
Hi.
Got your page. What's up?

Another one?

No, I know what it is. Uh...

and leave him on a vent.
He's been on ECMO for 12 days.
I don't think he has the strength
to withstand a transplant,
and that's even if we could find a donor.
So, then, what do you suggest?
I think you should have a very difficult conversation
with his parents. It's time.

Youngest cardio chief in the country?
More innovative and published than any of her peers?

We have done everything we can for that boy.
At this point, we're just prolonging his pain,
and his family's.
It's not giving up.
It's letting them go on.

I mean, the constant pressure

Are you mad
that I shouted no and made you get up?
No, I'm not mad at you.
I'm mad at my mom for bringing it up.
Are you... wanting to get married?
After you shouted no and made me get up?
No, not so much.
I meant, "No, you're misreading the moment,"
not, "No, I don't want to marry you."
So you do want to marry me?

I, um... haven't thought about it.
I haven't had time. Yeah.
I haven't had time either,
but I've still thought about it.
What have you thought?
I love you, and I love Scout,
and I love us together, and...
you know, marriage is, uh, I guess
kinda how society locks it all in...
Eh, but it doesn't lock it in.
It doesn't lock it in! Mnh.
And your parents' divorce was hell.
It was hell!

Mm-hmm.
So...

but, um...
have you really changed your mind?
I was a terrible wife.
You had a brain tumor. I did.

I still think I'm wired for self-destruction.
Why do you think that?
Because, every day,
for a lot of days now,

and think about getting high.

And it's not that I am sick of adults.
Okay, I'm a little... I'm a little sick of adults.

and I am so sick of worst days.

their dream,

And since, uh...
Since Alex left, um...
my house hasn't been my happiest place.
So...

And I think that you get that.

Well, don't fire her. Schmitt!

You're booking up hotel rooms.

I mean, name a trigger,
it is stronger.
For the record, I don't believe in Satan.

I'm just...
I just want to, like, drive to a dispensary

if I smoked weed,
it is very likely that I would forget to not do heroin.
Well...
for the record...
